Brasileiro acusado de matar advogado a mando de pirâmide com bitcoin é preso no Paraguai
05 Nov 2019, 12:20 by Portal do Bitcoin
Um dos suspeitos de um assassinato que envolve sócios da Valour Invest, empresa suspeita de atuar em esquema de pirâmide financeira com bitcoin, foi preso pela polícia na quinta-feira (31), no Paraguai.
Carlos Eduardo Fontes, que estava foragido, foi detido dentro de um shopping em Ciudad del Este, segundo o G1. Ele é suspeito de ter participado do assassinato do advogado Francisco de Assis Henrique, em junho deste ano, num posto de combustíveis no centro de São Paulo.
De acordo com o as investigações, Fontes e o comparsa, Anderson da Silva Soares, foram contratados por William Gonçalves Amaral e Danilo Afonso Pechin para matar o advogado, que, segundo a reportagem do site da Globo, já atuou em defesa de traficantes.
A intermediação do crime teria sido feita por Wilson Decaria Junior e Edgar Acioli Amador, sócios da Valour Invest. O valor pago para a dupla executar Assis teria sido a quantia de R$ 500 mil.
Logo que começaram as investigações, seis pessoas foram indiciadas e três suspeitos, incluindo Danilo Pechin, foram presos. Após o crime, Willian teria viajado para Portugal.
Dívida de R$ 2,5 milhões
Segundo a polícia, os donos da Valour Invest tinham uma dívida de R$ 2,5 milhões com o advogado, o que teria motivado o assassinato.
Conforme mostram as imagens das câmeras de segurança do local do crime, os assassinos dispararam pelo menos quatro tiros contra Assis, atearam fogo em seu carro e fugiram seguida.
Testemunhas disseram que antes da ação, o advogado teria jantado no restaurante que fica dentro do estabelecimento, que na Avenida Washington Luís.
Depois do crime nada foi levado pela dupla. De acordo com a reportagem, os dois já tiveram passagem pela polícia por roubo e ameaça.
Caso Valour Invest
A empresa dos acusados de envolvimento no assassinato do advogado é suspeita de operar em esquema de pirâmide financeira com bitcoin.
No mês passado, inclusive, a Justiça determinou busca e apreensão de criptomoedas pertencentes a Valour Invest em vários exchanges brasileiras e estrangeiras.
Segundo informações compartilhadas com o Portal do Bitcoin, a Valour Invest chegou a oferecer investimentos com lucro mensal de 10% e 13% ao mês. Os rendimentos seriam fruto de trading com criptomoedas.
Um investidor que amargou prejuízos com a empresa e que preferiu não se identificar afirmou que desde janeiro a empresa não pagava mais os investidores, mesmo após abaixar os seus rendimentos para 6% ao mês.
Questionados por conta no atraso de saques, os diretores da Valour Invest alegavam ter sofrido bloqueio da Bitfinex, que congelou todos os fundos.
Ainda segundo relatos, a empresa ameaçava que quem entrasse com ação na Justiça correria o risco de não receber.
No Reclame Aqui, queixas de pelo menos três meses atrás ainda não foram respondidas. Dentre as reclamações, destacam-se o não cumprimento de acordo e a retenção de bitcoins.

Brazilian accused of killing lawyer by bitcoin pyramid arrested in Paraguay
05 Nov 2019, 12:20 by Bitcoin Portal
One of the suspects in a murder involving partners in Value Invest, a company suspected of acting on a bitcoin financial pyramid scheme, was arrested by police on Thursday (31) in Paraguay.
Carlos Eduardo Fontes, who was on the run, was detained inside a mall in Ciudad del Este, according to the G1. He is suspected of having participated in the murder of lawyer Francisco de Assis Henrique in June this year at a gas station in downtown São Paulo.
According to the investigations, Fontes and his colleague, Anderson da Silva Soares, were hired by William Gonçalves Amaral and Danilo Afonso Pechin to kill the lawyer, who, according to a report on Globo's website, has already acted in defense of traffickers.
The crime was intermediated by Wilson Decaria Junior and Edgar Acioli Amador, partners of Valor Invest. The amount paid for the double execute Assisi would have been the amount of $ 500,000.
As soon as the investigations began, six people were indicted and three suspects, including Danilo Pechin, were arrested. After the crime, William would have traveled to Portugal.
Debt of R $ 2.5 million
According to police, the owners of Valor Invest had a debt of $ 2.5 million with the lawyer, which would have motivated the murder.
As the images from the crime scene security cameras show, the killers fired at least four shots at Assisi, set his car on fire and then fled.
Witnesses said that before the lawsuit, the attorney was said to have had dinner at the restaurant inside Washington Luis Avenue.
After the crime nothing was taken by the duo. According to the report, the two had already been passed by the police for theft and threat.
Valor Invest Case
The company of those accused of involvement in the murder of the lawyer is suspected of operating on bitcoin financial pyramid scheme.
Even last month, the court ordered the search and seizure of cryptocurrencies belonging to Valor Invest in various Brazilian and foreign exchanges.
According to information shared with the Bitcoin Portal, Valor Invest even offered investments with a monthly profit of 10% and 13% per month. The yields would come from trading with cryptocurrencies.
One investor who suffered losses with the company and who chose not to identify said that since January the company had not paid investors, even after lowering its earnings to 6% per month.
Asked about delayed withdrawals, the directors of Valor Invest claimed to have been blocked by Bitfinex, which froze all funds.
According to reports, the company threatened that anyone who filed a lawsuit would risk not receiving.
No Complain Here, complaints from at least three months ago have not yet been answered. Among the complaints, we highlight the non-compliance with the agreement and the retention of bitcoins.
